titleStmt.title: An apologie for the six book-sellers, subscribers of the second Beacon fired. Or, A vindication of them from the foul and unjust aspersions cast upon them by M. John Goodwin in a late pamphlet intituled A fresh discovery of the high Presbyterian spirit. Together with brief observations upon some remarkable passages in the said book. / By one that subscribes not his name, because he confesseth himself to be nullius nominis.
titleStmt.author: Nullius Nominus.

titleStmt.title: An apologie for the six book-sellers, subscribers of the second Beacon fired. Or, A vindication of them from the foul and unjust aspersions cast upon them by M. John Goodwin in a late pamphlet intituled A fresh discovery of the high Presbyterian spirit. Together with brief observations upon some remarkable passages in the said book. / By one that subscribes not his name, because he confesseth himself to be nullius nominis.
titleStmt.author: Nullius Nominus.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by S.G. for Matthew Keinton at the Fountain in Pauls Church-yard.,

notesStmt.note: This pamphlet was one of a series in a controversy over the publication of seditious or blasphemous works.
Annotations on Thomason copy: "Jan. 28 1654"; the final '5' in the imprint has been crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
